page.title: 08THWAITES TENNIS COURT
page.content: Three years ago a local person had the idea to have a tennis court in The Green because grown ups and children had to travel in to Millom for a game of tennis. The field that the tennis court was put in was given for the young to play on years ago, so they put a tennis court on it. The court took roughly 12 months to build and is 40 metres by 20 metres. The money was raised with the help of the Village Hall Committee, Sports Council, BNFL, Manpower Services and Copeland Council and it took about one year to raise. The time limited for people to stay and play on the court is one hour. Tennis tourniments are held annually. 22% of the families questioned make use of the tennis court.
